property_info.improvements: 4-story brick building, ground floor retail, upper floors office

owner_profile.owner_background: Local real estate investor, owns 6 commercial properties in downtown Toronto

project_context.public_visibility: Very high - major transit project in downtown core
project_context.required_acquisition: Partial taking - 2,400 sqft for station entrance and ventilation shaft

market_conditions.recent_sales_activity: Strong investor demand for downtown commercial
market_conditions.market_commentary: King Street West experiencing strong investor interest due to transit improvements and neighborhood gentrification

tenant_situation.ground_floor_retail: Independent coffee shop - 5 year lease expires 2027
tenant_situation.upper_floors: 3 small office tenants - Various lease terms
tenant_situation.relocation_impact: Station construction may disrupt retail tenant access

property_challenges.loading: No dedicated loading area - street access only
property_challenges.accessibility: No elevator - stairs only to upper floors

negotiation_history.current_status: Owner requests detailed valuation methodology and project impact analysis

strategic_notes.owner_psychology: Sophisticated investor with strong BATNA. No financial pressure. Knows market is rising. Will negotiate professionally but firmly. Likely to counter any offer below appraisal range.
key_challenges: Owner has no urgency to sell
High political visibility limits aggressive tactics
potential_leverage: Partial taking creates operational disruption beyond compensation
Construction impact on retail tenant may trigger lease issues
Station will ultimately benefit remaining property value
